word_forms.definition_en: the right to do or say what one wants

examples.example: After Simon turned eighteen, his parents gave him the freedom to watch any movies he wanted to.
examples.translate: Simon滿十八歲之後，他的父母讓他自由看任何他想看的電影。

word_forms.definition_en: a figure of a person, animal, god, goddess, etc. that is usually made of metal or stone

examples.example: The island of Hainan in China has a 108-meter statue of the goddess Kuanyin.
examples.translate: 中國的海南島有一座 108 公尺的觀音雕像。

word_forms.definition_en: to take a thing away from somewhere

examples.example: Jasmine chewed gum to remove the smell of garlic from her breath.
examples.translate: Jasmine 嚼口香糖來去除她口氣中的蒜味。

word_forms.definition_en: the act of doing activities for a special day or event

examples.example: Yvonne invited her friends out for dinner in celebration of finishing all of their exams.
examples.translate: Yvonne邀請她的朋友外出吃晚餐，慶祝他們完成所有的考試。

word_forms.definition_en: an event or activity held to celebrate something

examples.example: Every October 10 our country holds a national celebration to remember an important event in our country’s history.
examples.translate: 每年十月十日，我國都會舉辦國慶活動來紀念我國歷史上一個重要的事件。

word_forms.definition_en: to participate in a celebration or to honor a special occasion

examples.example: The whole country celebrated when their team won the FIFA World Cup for the first time.
examples.translate: 全國慶祝國家隊第一次贏得世界盃足球賽冠軍。

examples.example: The couple gave sticky rice and red eggs to their friends and family members to celebrate their son’s one-month birthday.
examples.translate: 這對夫妻送他們的親朋好友油飯和紅蛋來慶祝他們的兒子滿月。

word_forms.definition_en: freedom from being controlled by a person, a country, etc.

examples.example: India achieved independence from the United Kingdom on August 15, 1947.
examples.translate: 印度在 1947 年 8 月 15 日脫離英國完成獨立。

word_forms.definition_en: free from control or influence of others

examples.example: The Philippines has been independent from Spain for over 100 years, but about 3 million people there still speak Spanish.
examples.translate: 菲律賓已經脫離西班牙獨立超過一百年了，但那裡大約有三百萬人仍然說西班牙語。

word_forms.definition_en: a building, statue, or other large object built to remind us of an important person or event

examples.example: The Taiwan Salt Museum and Qigu Salt Mountain in Tainan are monuments to Taiwan’s salt producing past.
examples.translate: 在臺南的臺灣鹽博物館及七股鹽山是臺灣過去產鹽的見證。

word_forms.definition_en: to stand for something

examples.example: In Beauty and the Beast, the dying rose symbolizes the Beast’s chance of becoming human again.
examples.translate: 在《美女與野獸》當中，逐漸凋謝的玫瑰象徵野獸再次變成人類的機會。

word_forms.definition_en: something that represents an idea, concept, or quality

examples.example: In many cultures, the dove is regarded as a symbol of peace.
examples.translate: 在許多文化中，鴿子被認為是和平的象徵。

word_forms.definition_en: serving as a symbol

examples.example: The fifty stars on the American flag are symbolic of the country’s fifty states.
examples.translate: 在美國國旗上的五十顆星星象徵這個國家的五十個州。

word_forms.definition_en: in a strong way that will prevent something from becoming loose; with a strong will

examples.example: Jack firmly closed the lid of the jar so that it wouldn’t open accidentally.
examples.translate: Jack牢牢關緊罐子的蓋子，以讓它不會意外打開。

word_forms.definition_en: solid or strong in texture or structure

examples.example: The apples in the basket were all fresh, firm, and perfect for making pie.
examples.translate: 這個籃子裡的蘋果都很新鮮、結實，而且適合做派。

word_forms.definition_en: to be a symbol of something

examples.example: Sometimes Chinese speakers type “3Q” to represent the words “thank you” because “3Q” sounds like “thank you” in Chinese.
examples.translate: 有時候說華語的人會打出「3Q」來代表「謝謝你」這些字，因為「3Q」的華語聽起來像「thank you」。

word_forms.definition_en: to act or speak on behalf of someone or something

examples.example: Roberto was chosen to represent his class in the school performance because he is a good actor.
examples.translate: Roberto獲選代表他們班參加學校的表演，因為他是一個好演員。

word_forms.definition_en: the way something is shown or presented

examples.example: Wendy didn’t like the representation of women in the movie; all of them were shown as being quiet and weak.
examples.translate: Wendy不喜歡這部電影中女性的表現方式；她們全部都被呈現為安靜柔弱的樣子。

examples.example: The team created a small plastic representation of the tower they were planning to build.
examples.translate: 這個團隊為他們正計劃建造的塔樓製作了一個小塑膠模型。

word_forms.definition_en: from a period of time in the distant past

examples.example: The Great Wall was built thousands of years ago to stop ancient China’s enemies from invading.
examples.translate: 長城在數千年前被建造來阻擋古代中國敵人的攻擊。

word_forms.definition_en: the practice of owning and forcing people to work for no pay or the condition of being owned and forced to work for no pay

examples.example: This book is about a girl who was sold into slavery and made to work on a farm for years.
examples.translate: 這本書是關於一個被賣為奴隸，並被迫在農場上工作多年的女孩。

word_forms.definition_en: a person who is owned and forced to work for no pay

examples.example: When Abraham Lincoln ended slavery in the US, many of his friends still owned slaves.
examples.translate: 當亞伯拉罕．林肯結束了美國的奴隸制度時，他的許多朋友仍然擁有奴隸。

word_forms.definition_en: not equal or fair

examples.example: Several players cheated during the game, so everybody agrees that the final score is unfair.
examples.translate: 幾位球員在這場比賽中作弊，所以每個人都一致認為最後的分數是不公平的。

word_forms.definition_en: the way a person behaves toward or deals with another person or thing

examples.example: The prison was closed after many reports revealed the poor treatment of prisoners there.
examples.translate: 許多報告揭發了囚犯在那裡的惡劣待遇之後，這座監獄被關閉了。

word_forms.definition_en: a person who is traveling to or visiting a place for fun or to learn about it

examples.example: Mary and John went into the tourist center to ask for information about local hotels.
examples.translate: Mary和John到遊客中心去詢問關於當地飯店的資訊。

word_forms.definition_en: the industry or activity of traveling for pleasure

examples.example: Tourism in the country grew sharply after it was chosen as this year’s best place to visit by a popular magazine.
examples.translate: 這個國家被一本受歡迎的雜誌選為今年最佳旅遊地點後，旅遊業急速成長。

word_forms.definition_zh: 有吸引力的事物或地點
word_forms.definition_en: a place that people want to see or an activity that people want to do

examples.example: Beaches and water sports are the main attractions in Kenting.
examples.translate: 海灘和水上運動是墾丁最主要的賣點。

word_forms.definition_en: to draw someone or something toward something

examples.example: Famous sights such as the Eiffel Tower and Louvre Museum attract over 30 million tourists to Paris every year.
examples.translate: 像艾菲爾鐵塔和羅浮宮博物館這類有名的景點，每年吸引了超過三千萬遊客到巴黎。

word_forms.definition_en: pleasing or appealing to someone

examples.example: Modern buildings are not attractive to Britney because she thinks they are seldom unique.
examples.translate: Britney並不受現代建築吸引，因為她認為它們都不太獨特。

word_forms.definition_en: a large natural or man-made thing that makes it easy to know one’s location

examples.example: The Tokyo Tower and the Tokyo Skytree are two of Japan’s most famous landmarks.
examples.translate: 東京鐵塔和東京晴空塔是日本最有名地標中的兩個。

word_forms.definition_en: the world (used especially to emphasize its large size and round shape)

examples.example: Many of David Bowie’s fans around the globe posted images or words on Facebook and Instagram in memory of him after he died on January 10, 2016.
examples.translate: 大衛鮑伊在 2016 年 1 月 10 日去世後，全世界許多他的粉絲在臉書和Instagram上傳圖文紀念他。

word_forms.definition_en: relating to the whole world

examples.example: Many people believe that global warming is causing a higher number of large storms such as typhoons.
examples.translate: 許多人相信全球暖化正造成更多像颱風這樣的大型風暴。

word_forms.definition_en: despite the action or statement that follows

examples.example: Even though he has only heard it a few times before, Kyle knows all the words to this song.
examples.translate: 儘管以前只聽過這首歌幾次，Kyle知道所有的歌詞。

word_forms.definition_en: nearly; almost

examples.example: During the performance, close to two thousand people sang along with the band and created an unforgettable memory together.
examples.translate: 在表演期間，將近兩千人跟著樂團一同歌唱，一起創造了難忘的回憶。

word_forms.definition_en: as time passed or is passing

examples.example: Janice found the math class really tough at first, but it became easier over time.
examples.translate: Janice一開始認為數學課很難，但隨著時間過去，它變得較簡單。

word_forms.definition_en: to visit some place or someone

examples.example: Tracy decided to pay a visit to Big Ben while she was on a business trip in London.
examples.translate: Tracy決定去倫敦出差時參觀大笨鐘。

word_forms.definition_en: just like the way something always happens

examples.example: The noodle shop has a long line of people outside as always because they make the best noodles in town.
examples.translate: 一直以來，這家麵店外面都有著長長的人龍，因為他們做的麵是鎮上最棒的。

word_forms.definition_zh: 紐約市（位於美國紐約州）
貝德羅島（為Liberty Island的舊稱，於1956年正式改為此名）
自由島（位於美國紐約灣的小島，為自由女神像所在地）
弗里德利．奧古斯特．巴特勒迪（1834–1904，法國雕塑家，自由女神像的創作者）
大不列顛（包括英格蘭、蘇格蘭和威爾士）
利貝塔斯（古羅馬神話中的自主神）
